item.description:
Our next hike is going to be in the Eastern Block of Nehantic State Forest.  About 3 miles, some hills, mud - and the dogs love it!

 

(note:  a few folks were asking about Chapman Pond in East Haddam - we're doing that one the following weekend after Lori graciously agreed to make the directions there a lot easier through a few pictures.  Muchas gracias, Lori!)


State Web Site:
http://www.ct.gov/dep/cwp/view.asp?A=2716&Q=325064

Trail Map:
http://www.ct.gov/dep/lib/dep/stateparks/maps/nehanticrt11.pdf

Directions off website:
The parking lot is at the west end of Holmes Rd in East Lyme. You can put this address in your GPS:

99 Holmes Rd, East Lyme, CT 06333

Follow the road to the end.


Otherwise from route 85, turn onto (go west on) Salem Turnpike (actually a well-hidden and very small street), then bear left onto Holmes Rd, the parking area is all the way at the end.  If you're going North on 85, it's a few streets on the left after the Dinosaur Museum ... if going South on 85 and get to the Dino museum, you've gone too far.

If you're hungry after the hike, stop in at David's Place for some gyros or seafood - tell the gray-haired owner (Socrates) that Fred sent you...


http://maps.google.com/maps?hl=en&q=41.438,-72.264

 

Lost?  Call or SMS Fred.  860-227-4027.
item.how_to_find_us: Fred will be there in his little blue Korean street-legal go-kart.
item.name: Eastern Block of Nehantic State Forest
